titles: A discourse containing a louing inuitation both honourable, and profitable to all such as shall be aduenturers, either in person, or purse, for the aduancement of his Maiesties most hopeful plantation in the Nevv-found-land, lately vndertaken. Written by Captaine Richard Whitbourne of Exmouth, in the county of Deuon
Discourse containing a loving invitation for the advancement of his Majesties most hopefull plantation in the New-found-land
author: Whitbourne, Richard, Sir, fl. 1579-1626.
publisher: By Felix Kyngston, dwelling in Pater-noster-Row,
notes: Running title reads: A louing inuitation to all his Maiesties subiects.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Newfoundland --  Description and travel --  Early works to 1800.
